title: Individual Student Project Exam Day Validation
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria and examples or to score the response.

To earn one point, the response must describe a source's reliability using specific and relevant information in response to the prompt.

To earn two points, the response must explain a source's reliability using specific and relevant information in response to the prompt.
descriptions:
The response does not meet the criteria for points.

Prompt: Explain how you determined that one of your sources is reliable.

Responses that earn 1 point:

  • Responds to the Exam Day Validation prompt with relevant descriptive information and includes reference to specific sources as appropriate in response to the prompt.

Responses that earn 2 points:

  • Responds to the Exam Day Validation prompt with a relevant explanation and includes reference to specific sources as appropriate in response to the prompt.

Responses that earn 0 points:

  • Are too vague to provide any indication of the sources used in the Individual Student Project.

  • Do not reference the specific Exam Day Validation question.

  • May be general discussions of or reflections on the project in general.

Responds to the Exam Day Validation prompt with relevant descriptive information and includes reference to specific sources as appropriate in response to the prompt.

Prompt: Explain how you determined that one of your sources is reliable.

Example of a statement that earns one point for evidence:

  • “Author Z is a noted historian in the field of African American studies and was cited in two of the other sources I used in my research, (Title 1) and (Title 2).”

  • “The source by Author Z provided me with information that was supported by several other sources I found. It was referenced in two other sources I used for my project.”

Responses that earn 2 points:

  • Responds to the Exam Day Validation prompt with a relevant explanation and includes reference to specific sources as appropriate in response to the prompt.

Responds to the Exam Day Validation prompt with a relevant explanation and includes reference to specific sources as appropriate in response to the prompt.

Prompt: Explain how you determined that one of your sources is reliable.

Examples that successfully support an argument with evidence:

  • “The source is written by an author who has many articles and books written on similar topics. This helped me to determine the source was reliable and allowed me to use it to support the argument/claim of my project.”

  • “The source provided valuable insight into aspects of my topic that I had not expected. It was also cited in the bibliography of other well-known scholars whose work I used in the project, which showed me that it was a reliable source of information.”
